reviews.title: Liked, but with a few caveats
reviews.text: Location- great; at top of Spanish Steps near the Hassler. Very clean room and bath, and breakfast (average, but large) is brought to your door. Daytime guy, Aldo, is great, and will help with anything you need. Nighttime guy often not at desk. Try NOT to get a room facing the street when you reserve. Security is OK due to good location, but the Spanish Steps on Saturday night are EXTREMELY NOISY. I could not sleep that night. Try to get room facing elsewhere. Otherwise, it's fine for the money and location. Other reviewer is correct that lobby looks a little down at the heels, but the rest of the decor is fine.

reviews.title: Great Staff and Location! Okay hotel.
reviews.text: Great Location! Great Staff! Rooms are okay but the plumbing was noisy.

reviews.title: I'd stay there again
reviews.text: No internet access. Cash or checks only. Reseration had to be by fax.

reviews.title: A great hotel
reviews.text: This place is a great value compared to the other hotels in the neighborhood. The clean and attractive room had a small private balcony and a decent-sized bathroom. Unfortunately there was no rooftop breakfast area, which seems to be the norm among the competition. When I was there in May 2003 I paid with a credit card. They offered a convenient and reasonably priced car service to the airport, and let me charge that as well.

reviews.title: Gregoriana: if you can do better go elsewhere
reviews.text: I think this is a GREAT hotel. What is better than walking out your door in the morning and being at the TOP of the Spanish Steops? THis is a tiny, well run hotel with a great staff and very good prices..who cares if you have to pay cash? THe Hotel hassler across the street is US $550 per night. As far as it being run down, it was VERY nice when i was there recently.

reviews.title: Will be going back soon!
reviews.text: This hotel is right at the top of the Spanish Steps close to everything. Rooms have been remodeled and are beautiful. Ask for 1st floor overlooking courtyard. Aldo and all staff will bend over backwards to find what you need in hotel or in Rome. We paid by credit card and made reservations over the phone. Can't wait to return and will ONLY stay at Hotel Gregoriana!

So the hotel is small and Italians like to smoke which means you might have to put a towel under your door occasionally if you are a sensitive non-smoker like myself, but honestly, I have stayed in a lot of hotels around the world, some really fancy and Hotel Gregoriana rates with the best. Why, when some of the rooms are small, the breakfast is oooookaaaay (but hey, its included and delivered to your room) and the smoking thing? Because Aldo, Marcello and co make you feel so safe, comfortable and cared for in a big city. The location is unbelievable, in the thick of things but quiet and the rates are even more unbelievable for Rome. The new decor is really charming (art deco, simply and stylish) the towels are excellent (there are towel warmers too), beds are comfy, linen crisp, there is CNN, and Aldo really knows Rome. Just dont get your washing done... some things you only do once. Ouch!!
reviews.title: My Rome home!!

reviews.text: I was at the Gregoriana for four days at the beginning of my Italian adventure, then four days at the end and the final stint truly felt like a homecoming. They even upgraded me.
reviews.title: Trendy and stylish
We loved every minute of our stay!
reviews.text: Just regards that location again,if you dont fancy the mayhem of the Spanish Steps, consider the fact that the Gregoriana is down the hill slightly and away from the action enough for sleeping. The Barberini Metro is very nearby, the Pantheon, Trevi fountain and a plethora of other monuments a walk (I walked to the Vatican several times, it took a while but ay, what a walk!) and it is an easy return for a siesta then out again.

reviews.title: Enjoyed the Gregoriana, a little pricey though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for the first part of our trip to Italy for our 1 year anniversary. We arrived early in the morning on April 26th. The hotel kept our bags and gave us breakfast until our room was ready a few hours later. Breakfast consisted of a basket of rolls, crussants, and cookies with different spreads. Coffee, tea, juice. We also saw someone eatting an egg one morning, so I guess you can request that too. Aldo and Sandro were very nice and helped us out with any questions we had. The hotel is 4 or 5 floors I believe. There is an elevator, but it is small. We had a room facing the street. It was very quiet even though it was 1 block from the top of the Spanish Steps. I loved how you could open the shutters and take in some of Rome. The bathroom was complete with a shower tub, however the glass only covered part of the shower, so we got water on the floor a couple of times. There is a hairdryer in the room, although not that great. Aldo let me borrow a converter to use because for some reason mine wouldn't work. The bed was comfy and the room had a small flat pannel tv. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Gregoriana and would reccommend it to others.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

likes.disliked: — getting water on the floor while taking a shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the Gregoriana in May 2007 and would definitely return. The hotel is perfectly located 1 block from the Spanish steps and is an easy walk to tons of great shopping and restaurants. The staff was super friendly and accomodating. We had a 3rd guest meeting us there for the final 2 nights of our stay, and the staff made sure we received an extra bed and pillows. The room was charming, clean, and had a wonderful balcony complete with a table for 2. The staff had excellent restaurant recommendations and the hotel contributed to one of the best weekends of my life. Great memories of that balcony...
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: This was my 4th stay at Gregoriana and it continues to be my favorite. I had friends traveling with me and they agreed with me about the location, comfort, cleanliness, and Aldo. Our luggage was lost on the way to Rome. Aldo did his best to help us find it, to no avail. When we decided to leave Rome early, he was very understanding and did not charge us for the unused room nights. Will definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Still Love the Gregoriana

reviews.text: Hotel Gregoriana is as good as others on this site have said it is; the staff - led by Aldo - are very friendly, efficient and welcoming; the location is superb (at the top of the Spanish Steps) and the rooms - although small - are very, very attractive. The hotel has been recently refurbished: the single room I had had a parquetry floor, a comfortable bed with a beautiful parquetry bedhead and lovely pictures on the wall - all connected to a kind of 1940's-1950's retro kind of theme, and all immaculately clean and even pretty. Beautiful heavy fabric curtains - and a window that looked out onto the street. Via Gregoriana is a small street that is one of two that leads away from the top of the Spanish Steps; the other one has one of those hugely expensive, swanky hotels. This street has no other hotels at all and, thus, at night there is virtually no noise at all; I did not hear another noise at night from other guests, either - and, so, if you want to stay in a place where people are quietly well-heeled without being painful or inconsiderate, this place will suit. Breakfast is not a great event - a little basket of pastries, toast with condiments, etc. and coffee/tea but, in a sense, the whole of Rome is 5 minutes walk away and, so, if you want something else, you can go and get it. But for peace and quiet, cleanliness, friendliness and price - this is a great little hotel. I will happily return there for my next trip to Rome. In fact, when I was checking out, I was charged less than I was quoted when I booked the room; now, how often does that happen?
reviews.title: A great little hotel in a superb location

likes.disliked: — Everything was fine; the room was small - but that was fine

reviews.title: loved the gregoriana in 1987
reviews.text: I stayed at the Gregoriana about 20 years ago with my daughter and I've never forgotton it. It was my first trip to Rome. I was mesmerized. The Gregoriana fit my mind's image of what a small hotel in Rome should look and feel like. I'd love to return. I'm only afraid the reality of the present will never live up to my recollections of the past.
